instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00281: What is 820-00281? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3H: What is PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3H? This is the input from the USB-C charger or the battery that is the input voltage for the chip responsible for creating PP3V3_G3H. It can be missing when capacitors on this line are shorted to ground, or when the diode in front of it leading to the chip that creates PP3V3_G3H is blown. .
definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - A.  Not powering on
threads.message:
Hello everyone. 

I'm new in the forum, and I am not a native English speaker so just in case I make mistakes writing, i'm using google translate.
I hope to find some help here, thanks

<SIGNAL>PP20V_USBC_XA_VBUS</SIGNAL> =  5.207 v

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_REG_R</SIGNAL>=  3.418 v

<SIGNAL>PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3H</SIGNAL> =  4.886 v

<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H_CHGR_R</SIGNAL> =  5.197 v

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H_R</SIGNAL> =  0.029 v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - A.  Not powering on
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

Any history fault available?
Do you get the same behaviour on all 4 ports?
Compare diode mode readings on LDO outputs of all <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> chips; 1V1, 1V8, 3V3.
Be sure to use correct USB-C charger.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - A.  Not powering on
threads.message:
Thanks for the welcome.
- The board was with  a voltage problem varying between 5v and 1v in <SIGNAL>PP20V_USBC_XA_VBUS</SIGNAL> in <CHIP>U3100</CHIP> thus i replaced <CHIP>U3100</CHIP> , after that is the actual condition

- Yes is the same behavior on all 4 ports now 

- All 4 has similar values and 1v1 ,1v8 and 3v3 voltages are presents  in UB300 and  UB400 but  in <CHIP>U3100</CHIP> and <CHIP>U3200</CHIP> are present 1v8 and 3v3 but 1v1 is 0v
  and diodo mode in chips are 
   <CHIP>U3100</CHIP> 1v1 = 513.     
   <CHIP>U3200</CHIP>  1v1 = 495
   UB400  1v1 = 516
   UB300  1v1  = 517 

- Yes i have a 87w original charger an works good in other macbook

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - A.  Not powering on
threads.message: Change <CHIP>U3200</CHIP> first; check if 1V1 LDO appears then.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - A.  Not powering on
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 62727, member: 682"]
Change <CHIP>U3200</CHIP> first; check if 1V1 LDO appears then.
[/QUOTE]

Done i have already changed it and now in diodo mode 1v1 has 515 but it has the same behavior not 1v1 , in addition to that, i figured out that  <RESISTOR>R3034</RESISTOR> <SIGNAL>UPC_XB_HPD_RX</SIGNAL>  and <RESISTOR>R3033</RESISTOR> <SIGNAL>UPC_XA_HPD_RX</SIGNAL> has 0 ohm and the schematic shows that both 100kohms,  i have already changed too for 100kohms , the board has the same behavior

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - A.  Not powering on
threads.message:
Any reason to quote an entire text visible few centimeters above?
Do not hit Reply button, just write inside the down box.
Please, maintain forum aesthetic...

Did you really find <RESISTOR>R3033</RESISTOR>/34 in the board?
Appear like NO STUFF in the schematic; put back original ones.

Change <CHIP>U3100</CHIP> now...
